basic_info.official_name: Chulalongkorn University Graduate Scholarship Program for ASEAN or Non-ASEAN Countries

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded Scholarships by Thai Government. The scholarship will cover all expenses for the duration of the study, offering full financial support.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to all excellent international students from ASEAN or Non-ASEAN countries, and candidates from all around the world (excluding Thai nationals). Students who have been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester are not eligible to apply.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s and PhD degree programs in a wide range of academic fields (All Subjects).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA requirement typically around 3.25 in graduate studies.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree for Master's program; Master's degree for PhD program.

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum of one-year's relevant work experience for MBA programs.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Strong command of English must be demonstrated, either by a certificate of English proficiency from the applicant’s prior university or by results on standardised tests like the TOEFL (min. 500) or IELTS (min. 5.0).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters from the Head, the Director or the Dean.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Study plan / description of academic interests (on a separate sheet of A4-sized paper).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Must be in good health (good physical health). Recipients are not allowed to accept any off-campus employment in Thailand during the term of the scholarship.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: No application fee. Required documents include Curriculum Vitae, Copy of Certificate of Graduation and an official transcript of academic records, English proficiency score record, Copy of passport, One 1-inch-colored photos (with blue background) taken no more than six months in polite attire, signed on the reverse side.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed application form, Curriculum Vitae, Copy of Certificate of Graduation and an official transcript of academic records, English proficiency score record, Copy of passport, Study plan / description of academic interests, One 1-inch-colored photos, Two recommendation letters.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants must send the completed application form and relevant documents directly to the Faculty/Program of their choice before the deadline set by the University’s Office of Academic Affairs (at least 2 weeks prior to the deadline).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Chulalongkorn University is Thailand’s oldest and most prestigious University, established by King Vajiravudh on 26 March 1917. The Graduate Scholarship Program for ASEAN or Non-ASEAN countries was established to provide financial assistance to international students pursuing higher graduate studies.

basic_info.official_name: Danish Government Scholarship (University of Southern Denmark)
basic_info.provider: Danish Government, Ministry of Higher Education and Science

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship, granted either as full or partial tuition fee waivers. It covers full tuition fees and provides a monthly stipend to support living expenses, or a grant to help with living costs.

timeline_info.application_deadline: February intake: 15 October 2025; September intake: 1 March 2026; General: 8th January 2026; MSc program: February 1, 2026

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from non-EU/EEA countries who are eligible to pay tuition fees. Applicants must be highly qualified and accepted into a full-time Master's program at the University of Southern Denmark. Not eligible if receiving the Danish State Grant.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s studies, specific Master’s degree programs, specific engineering Master’s programs (e.g., Mechatronics Engineering), programs offered on the new campus in Vejle, Sønderborg Master’s programs.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Only offered for specific Master’s degree programs, primarily in engineering, at the University of Southern Denmark's Vejle or Sønderborg campuses.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s degree (or completion of courses comparable to 180 ECTS credits for master-level courses for exchange/guest students)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS score of at least 6.5; TOEFL score of 575/230/88

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must complete and submit the online admission application for the chosen master’s program at SDU. Incomplete or late applications will not be eligible.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online admission application for the chosen master’s program; completed scholarship application form (via the university’s portal); all necessary documents.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Highly qualified applicants are considered. For eligible MSc in Engineering programs, students are automatically considered for the scholarship upon applying for the program. Incomplete or late applications are not eligible.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship acknowledges the important impact and investment that non-EU/EEA students make during their education, assisting them in their educational pursuits and offering a transformative chance for postgraduate education.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for the 2026-2027 academic year, with autumn semester beginning September 2026.

basic_info.official_name: Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship for Foreign Students Tenable in Brunei Darussalam (BDGS)

covered_expenses: economy class air-ticket to Brunei Darussalam from the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/ country of domicile prior to the commencement of the course
economy class air-ticket from Brunei Darussalam to the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/country of domicile upon completion of the course

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International Students; Foreign Students; citizens of OIC Member States (for specific calls); BDGS (IS) for international students

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Diploma, Undergraduate Degree, Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs in various disciplines including Arts, sciences, engineering, Islamic studies, business, humanities.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum qualification of Five (5) Distinctions (As & Bs) in the Senior; Applicants must meet the minimum qualification set by the University for Admission to graduate studies, including a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Diploma, Undergraduate Degree, Postgraduate Master’s Degree

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficient in English with a Credit 6 at GCE 'O' Level Examination or a Grade 'C' in IGCSE English (as a second language) or an IELTS score of 6.0

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Reference Letter required for assessment on the applicant's academic ability.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Essay of up to 200 words describing plan of study and/or research and relating it to future career plan; personal statement.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Age of a bachelor's degree student should not exceed 25 years.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Upon completion of the program, the scholarship recipient will be required to leave Brunei Darussalam with immediate effect. A scholarship recipient is not permitted to undertake any paid employment or to serve on the staff of any country’s representative mission in Brunei Darussalam during the duration of the scholarship. Conform to all the rules and regulations underlying this scholarship award scheme.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online Application Form (BDGS Application Form); Applicants applying to Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD) must also complete an online application through UBD's admission portal; Completed application forms to be emailed to specified address (e.g., applvbdqs2022@mfa.qov.bn for 2022/2023).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Prestigious scholarship offering unique opportunity for international students to pursue Diploma, Undergraduate, and Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs at leading institutions in Brunei Darussalam, including Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD), Universiti Islam Sultan Sharif Ali (UNISSA), Universiti Teknologi Brunei (UTB), Kolej Universiti Perguruan Ugama Seri Begawan (KUPU SB) and Politeknik Brunei (PB).

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship for international students.
covered_expenses: monthly stipend up to 9000 TL per month

timeline_info.application_deadline: February 20 annually (main application period); Research Scholarship applications are received 4 times a year.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Around 5,000 new scholarships awarded each year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: General eligibility criteria apply to all applicants, though specific requirements may vary by study level and scholarship category. Applicants must fulfill specific requirements, including academic qualifications, age limits, and language proficiency. Individuals who are currently enrolled in programs in Turkish universities at the level of education they will apply for are an eligible group.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Wide range of disciplines and fields, including undergraduate, master's, PhD, research, and art scholarships. Competitive majors like medicine and engineering are also offered.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Undergraduate scholarships are regionally defined and focused on developing countries and regions with historical links with Turkey.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Undergraduate: Minimum GPA of 70% or 3.0/4.0. Master's: Minimum GPA of 75% or 3.5/4.0. PhD: Minimum GPA of 75%.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Scholarships are available for associate, undergraduate, master, and PhD levels of higher education. A bachelor's degree is required for master's applications.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: International exam results (GRE, GMAT, SAT, etc.) if required by the chosen university or program. International language test results such as TOEFL, DELF if required. Candidates wishing to study in English or other language medium programs must provide an internationally accepted language proficiency certificate. All awardees without a C1 Level Turkish Proficiency Certificate must attend a 1-year Turkish Language Course and attain C1 level by the end of the academic year, even if placed in English programs.

additional_requirements.career_plan: A personal statement is a crucial component, outlining motivations, academic goals, and what the applicant hopes to achieve. It should be tailored to emphasize how the applicant meets specific criteria.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Undergraduate: Under 21 years. Master's: Under 30 years. PhD: Under 35 years. Research Scholarship: Under 50 years.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Required documents include academic achievements (GPA, coursework, honors/awards), language proficiency certificates (TOEFL, DELF, etc.), international exam results (GRE, GMAT, SAT, etc.) if required by the university/program, a personal statement, and recommendation letters.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Highly competitive, with over 250,000 applications for the 2024/2025 cycle. Interviews are usually held at Turkish embassies or consulates in the applicant’s home country.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Government-funded, competitive scholarship program for outstanding international students. It is the largest Turkish scholarship program, aiming to strengthen educational and cultural ties by offering quality education at prestigious Turkish universities across various study levels (associate, undergraduate, master's, PhD, research, art, and joint programs).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Main application period is annually between January 10 and February 20. Research Scholarship applications are received 4 times a year.

basic_info.provider: Chinese Government, China Scholarship Council (CSC), Chinese Ministry of Education

funding_info.funding_details: Full scholarship covering tuition, accommodation, stipend, and comprehensive medical insurance. Some programs may be partially funded. The scholarship amount, approximately 10,000 USD, is disbursed to Chinese universities, not directly to individual students.

timeline_info.opening_date: Application for Academic Year 2026/2027 is now open.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Over 50,000 international students awarded annually. Specific numbers vary by country and program (e.g., 15 for Brunei in 2018-19, 1 for Ireland).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding international students, teachers, and scholars from all over the world (non-Chinese citizens). Applicants must be in good health. Some programs (e.g., 'Silk Road') may require nationality from 'One Belt One Road' initiative countries, while others are open to all nationalities. Dual nationality holders may not be eligible. Applicants must not have completed previous study in China within the last year. Eligibility is open to undergraduate, master's, doctoral students, as well as general and senior scholars. Specific programs may have additional criteria (e.g., AASCU program for students at AASCU member institutions).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: A wide variety of academic programs, full-time degree programs (Bachelor, Master, PhD), Chinese language study, or academic research.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.3 on a 4-point scale (or 80 on a 100-point scale).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's applicants: equivalent to senior high school certificate. Master's applicants: Bachelor's degree. PhD applicants: Master's degree or higher.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least three years of work experience (for some programs/applicants).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: HSK score report required for Chinese-taught programs. Bachelor's applicants: minimum HSK 3 (180). Master's and PhD applicants for Chinese-taught programs: minimum HSK 4 (180). No Chinese proficiency required for general scholar applicants studying Chinese language. Applicants with minimum HSK but not meeting direct major entry requirements may need 1-2 years of preparatory Chinese language courses.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation in Chinese or English from professors or associate professors for graduate programs or senior scholar programs.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Study Plan or Research Proposal required (Undergraduate: min 200 words; Master's/PhD: min 800 words) in English or Chinese.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Undergraduate: under 25 years old. Master's: under 35 years old. Doctoral: under 40 years old. General Scholar: under 35 years old. HSK winner scholarship: under 40 years old.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: CSC Type C scholarship is for students already studying in China. If study plan exceeds AY 2026/2027, host university funding may be needed for the exceeded period. Applicants must obtain an acceptance letter from a Chinese university to secure a fully funded scholarship.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must consciously abide by Chinese laws and regulations. Applicants must be citizens of a country other than the People's Republic of China.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed application materials, Application Form for Chinese Government Scholarship (online), valid HSK score report (if applicable), two letters of recommendation (if applicable), Study Plan or Research Proposal, Admission Notice, Visa Application for Study In China (JW201), Foreigner Physical Examination Form, valid ordinary passport.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants apply online via CGSIS (www.campuschina.org), identify preferred scholarship program, university, and major (up to three preferred universities). Some programs require nomination from National Commissions (e.g., UNESCO). Acceptance by Chinese institutions and endorsement from the Ministry of Education of China are required.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS) is a prestigious program sponsoring international students, teachers, and scholars to study and conduct research in China. It is offered by the Chinese Government, China Scholarship Council (CSC), and Chinese Ministry of Education. Administered through various channels including Chinese Embassies/Consulates (e.g., in USA, South Sudan, Montreal), and organizations like AASCU. It supports short-term or long-term study at over 250-289 designated Chinese universities. Specific programs exist, such as the 'Silk Road' program (for 'One Belt One Road' countries) and the 'Great Wall Program' (for developing countries via UNESCO). Over 50,000 international students are awarded annually.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are for Academic Year 2026/2027. The application period is open, with a general deadline of February 8, 2026. Specific university deadlines may vary (e.g., February 15, 2025 for Shanghai University for AY 2025).

basic_info.provider: Hungarian Government, Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade (managed), Tempus Public Foundation (co-ordinated)

funding_info.funding_details: The programme provides tuition-free education, a monthly stipend, accommodation contribution, and medical insurance. For doctoral level, the monthly stipend is HUF 140,000 (cca EUR 390/365) for the first phase (4 semesters) and HUF 180,000 (cca EUR 500/470) for the second phase (4 semesters) – for 12 months a year. Accommodation contribution is HUF 40,000/month or a free dormitory place.

timeline_info.application_deadline: February 2026 (for 2026/2027 academic year, for online application submission)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign students and high-achieving international students with an excellent academic track record. Eligibility is based on bilateral educational agreements between Hungary and the governments of the sending partners. Applicants are eligible to apply only for scholarship types and study fields determined in these cooperation programmes. Candidates must be 18 years old before August 30. Self-financed students currently studying in a Hungarian Higher Education Institution are only eligible to apply for the same study level under specific conditions (details cut off in provided content).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Wide range of degree programmes across various scientific fields and study levels. Specific examples include Communication and Media Studies (SH Sport), English and American Studies (SH Sport), Applied Economics (SH Sport), Computer Science (SH Sport), International Public Service Studies (SH Sport). Programmes are offered by 28 Hungarian higher education institutions, including Semmelweis University, Eötvös Loránd University, and the University of Debrecen.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants can only apply for scholarship types and study fields defined by the educational cooperation programmes with their specific Sending Partner. Pakistani nationals are required not to change discipline after final award of scholarship.

academic_requirements.required_degree: For Bachelor's/One-tier Master's: scanned copy of the original secondary school graduation certificate or equivalent AND its translation. For Master's: scanned copy of the original bachelor’s degree certificate or equivalent AND its translation (16 years Bachelors degree or equivalent for Pakistan). For PhD: 17/18 years Degree or equivalent (for Pakistan).

experience_requirements.accepted_types: For Doctoral full degree (Brazil specific): Scientific or technological research production (published articles, book chapters, book authorship, publications in event annals), coordination of a research or extension project.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Official test result or certificate must be provided (program specific proficiency requirements). Accepted tests include TOEFL IBT, TOEFL ITP, IELTS, or Cambridge Certificate. Proof of previous studies in the language of the selected program can also be accepted. Some programs may require an entrance examination in Biology, Chemistry, and English Language.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Some sending partners require a commitment to return and work in the home country for a specified period after studies (e.g., Kazakhstan, Pakistan).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Current scholarship holders must earn at least eighteen credits (total 36 credits) on average of the last two semesters. Pakistani nationals must submit a bond not to change discipline and to serve the country after graduation. Consent to data processing and obligation to inform about criminal proceedings during the scholarship period are required.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application, application guide, Call for Applications, secondary school graduation certificate/equivalent, bachelor’s degree certificate/equivalent, master’s diploma (optional), proficiency test results, updated curriculum vitae (for Brazil PhD), Statement of the Supervisor (for doctoral, if required), certificate about student status (for partial studies). Translations are required if original documents are not in the language of the selected study programme or Hungarian.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants are informed about results by their country's ministry of education or national scholarship office/agency. Some universities may have entrance examinations (e.g., written and oral in Biology, Chemistry, English Language for University of Szeged medical programs).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Launched by the Hungarian Government in 2013 to promote the internationalisation of Hungarian higher education, strengthen international academic relations, and enhance Hungary's reputation. It attracts top international students, with over 12,000 currently studying in Hungary.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application system typically opens around mid-November for the following academic year. For 2025/2026, it opened mid-November 2024. For 2026/2027, it is expected to open mid-November 2025, with online application submission in January-February 2026.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded with specific funding levels depending on the prize type (first prize or second prize). Monthly Stipend (10 months): Bachelor: CNY 1400, Master: CNY 1700, PhD: CNY 2000. Comprehensive insurance coverage worth CNY 800/year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students (foreign self-funded) who are prospective or current undergraduate, postgraduate, or PhD students normally enrolled in Tianjin. Applicants must meet the language requirements of the higher education institutions.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Chemical Engineering (Master's program at Tianjin University)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: High School applicants: Minimum average of 80% or above. College/University applicants: Minimum GPA of 3.0 or above.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For Chinese-instructed programs: HSK-5 certificate with a minimum score of 180. For English-instructed programs: English Proficiency Certificates.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Personal Statement, including study or research plan (no less than 800 words for Master and Doctor Degree, no less than 300 words for Bachelor’ degree application).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Scholarship is for one academic year and may be renewed annually based on academic performance and compliance with university policies. Applicants are required to apply annually.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form (to be filled in Chinese or English by typing, pasted with a recent photo), HSK-5 certificate (for Chinese-instructed programs), English Proficiency Certificates (for English-instructed programs), Personal Statement (including study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, personal strengths, no less than 800 words for Master and Doctor Degree, no less than 300 words for Bachelor’ degree application), Application Form for Foreigners Wishing to Study at Tianjin University (for Tianjin University applicants).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Assessment results publicized for one week, then submitted to Tianjin Municipal Education Commission. Scholarship list determined by experts organized by Tianjin Municipal Education Commission. Admission results announced officially on university website, Admission Notice and Visa Application Form (JW202) sent to winners from July 1 to August 31.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A one-year duration scholarship offering full financial support for international students (prospective and current) at universities in Tianjin, renewable annually based on performance.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Admission results and documents sent to scholarship winners from July 1 to August 31.

basic_info.official_name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES)
basic_info.provider: Government of Ireland, managed by Higher Education Authority (HEA)

funding_info.funding_details: 60 scholarships are awarded annually for one year of full-time, in-person study at the master’s, postgraduate diploma, or PhD level. Each scholarship includes a €10,000 stipend and a full tuition fee waiver from the host institution.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to high-calibre international students (non-EU/non-EEA/non-Switzerland/non-UK citizens) who have a domiciliary of origin outside the EU/EEA/Switzerland/United Kingdom. Applicants must have a conditional or final offer of admission to a full-time postgraduate programme (NFQ levels 9 or 10: master’s, postgraduate diploma, or PhD) at an eligible Irish higher education institution at the time of applying. Applicants must not have previously held a GOI-IES scholarship. For research master’s, applicants must not currently hold or have previously held a Council Postgraduate Scholarship. For PhD, applicants must not currently hold or have previously held any Council Postgraduate Scholarship other than those for a research master’s degree.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum of a 2.1 honors undergraduate degree (or equivalent)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s, postgraduate diploma, or PhD (NFQ levels 9 or 10)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of English language proficiency is required. Specific scores mentioned: IELTS: Minimum score of 5 (no band lower than 6.0); TOEFL: Minimum score of 90.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: References are required, should be between 500 and 1,000 words, and must clearly demonstrate how the applicant matches the candidate profile. Candidates are responsible for uploading the references provided to them by referees.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants should demonstrate academic excellence, leadership potential, and a commitment to global engagement, with the potential to be future leaders in their field and committed to making a difference in the world. A carefully prepared application demonstrating academic excellence and alignment with the scholarship goals is essential.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts, recommendation letters, personal statements, and a conditional or final offer of admission from an eligible Irish higher education institution. Applicants must register on the Government of Ireland scholarship portal (https://webportalapp.com/sp/login/heagrantapplication) to access the application form.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Information about the selection process is available in the 'Selection Process Infographic' downloadable from the official HEA webpage. Selection criteria include academic excellence, leadership potential, and commitment to global engagement.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES) programme supports high-calibre international students to study at master’s, postgraduate diploma or PhD level in Ireland. It is a highly competitive program designed to attract top-tier international students who have the potential to be future leaders and are committed to making a difference in the world, offering an academically enriching and financially feasible experience.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship is for the 2025/2026 academic year, supporting one year of full-time study.

basic_info.provider: Thailand Government, Thailand International Development Cooperation Agency (TICA), Ministry of Foreign Affairs

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded master’s scholarships and fellowships. Provides 100% tuition coverage, monthly living allowances, research funding, and other allowances.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Available for international students from developing countries. Candidates must fulfill all requirements, including those prescribed by BCSR 2023 for civil servants or Department of Workforce Planning and Skills Development, MoESD for applicants outside civil service. Requires nomination by the National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation (e.g., Ministry of Foreign Affairs) or relevant central government agencies. Must have good physical and mental condition and not be pregnant.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Development topics under six themes: Sufficiency Economy Philosophy (SEP), Public Health, Agriculture and Food Security, Climate Change and Environmental Issues, Bio-Circular-Green Economy (BCG Model), and other topics related to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (for Master's and Ph.D. programs)

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience with the nominating agency

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Good English proficiency, English language certificate (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS) required.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Must have good physical and mental condition and not be pregnant.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Full-time study is required. Nomination by National Focal Point or relevant central government agency is mandatory.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form (online and hard copy), English language certificate (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS), Recommendation letters, Thesis proposal or other university-requested documents, Physical Examination form.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Candidates must be nominated by their National Focal Point. The application procedure is completed when TICA receives the hard copy of the application form and other related documents through the Royal Thai Embassy/Permanent Mission. Early applications receive priority consideration and higher funding.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in 1999/2000 by the Royal Thai Government’s Thailand International Development Cooperation Agency (TICA), Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Aims to foster cooperation partnerships among developing countries, share Thailand’s best practices and experience, build global partnerships, empower students with advanced skills and knowledge, and allow participants to experience Thailand’s rich culture and hospitality.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are available for 2025 and 2026-2027 academic years, primarily for Master's and Ph.D. programs.

basic_info.provider: Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship covering tuition fees, monthly allowances, and health insurance. Monthly allowance is 900 Euros quarterly or €16,243–€18,800/year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students (foreign students not residing in Italy) and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Applicants must hold appropriate academic qualifications for their chosen program and meet specific age and language criteria. The scholarship is incompatible with any other grant from the Italian Government or public institutions.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Bachelor's, Master's, PhD, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) programs, research under academic supervision, Specialization and Vocational Schools, and Italian Language and Culture courses.
field_restrictions.restrictions: No other Italian government scholarship allowed

academic_requirements.required_degree: For Bachelor's: completed secondary education. For Master's: relevant bachelor’s degree. For PhD: master’s degree. All applicants must hold an appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in the Italian University/Institute.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in Italian or English language is required, depending on the program. For Italian-taught programs, a minimum B2 CEFR level in Italian is required. For Italian Language and Culture courses, Italian A2 CEFR is required. A language certification issued by a university language teacher may be accepted.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Bachelor’s Degree: ≤ 23 years old; Master’s Degree/AFAM/Italian Language and Culture Courses: ≤ 28 years old (by deadline, except renewals); PhD: ≤ 30 years old.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: For PhD programs, a letter of acceptance from the relevant Italian University is required. Selection is based on academic merit, motivation, and language proficiency. A selection committee appointed by the Italian Embassy in each country makes the final decision based on academic performance and personal criteria.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Letter of acceptance (for PhD), certificate of Italian language proficiency, evidence of previous academic credentials and language skills.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection is based on academic merit, motivation, and knowledge of the Italian or English language. A selection committee appointed by the Italian Embassy in each country makes the decision based on academic performance and other personal criteria.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship is offered by the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI) to promote cultural exchange and academic excellence. Scholarships can be 3, 6, or 9 months long. 9-month scholarships are renewable for multi-year courses (available Nov 1, 2025 - July 31, 2026). 3-month scholarships are exclusively for advanced Italian language and culture courses (available Jan 1 - Sep 30, 2026). While some sources mention a housing allowance, others state that accommodation expenses are not covered.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: The scholarship is primarily offered for the 2025-2026 academic year, with application deadlines typically in mid-May 2025. Information for the 2026-2027 academic year suggests study application deadlines in January 2026 and scholarship application in February 2026.

basic_info.provider: Government of Flanders; Flemish Ministry of Education and Training

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded. Provides a grant of €10,000 (or €10,020) plus a tuition fee waiver per academic year.

timeline_info.application_deadline: January 15, 2026 (for 2026-2027 academic year, university application including scholarship candidacy form)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Outstanding international students worldwide. Must be accepted by a Flemish host institution for an eligible master's degree program. The previous degree (used for master's enrollment) cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution. International students who have previously been enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution on credit mobility (e.g., Erasmus+) are still eligible. Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution cannot apply.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Eligible master's programmes in Humanities and Social Sciences, Science, Engineering and other fields at Flemish higher education institutions.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Preparatory programmes and distance learning programmes are not eligible.

academic_requirements.required_degree: A previous degree qualifying for Master's admission

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: IELTS: minimum 7.0 overall band score; TOEFL: minimum 94 total score; C1 level on Certificate in Advanced

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters are required. Reasons for recommending the applicant are part of the selection criteria.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Quality of applicant's motivation (30 points), top talent profile of the applicant (10 points).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Master Mind application form (mandatory for Master Mind scholarship), KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (as an annexe to university application), Transcript of records, two recommendation letters, proof of admission to a master's program at a university in Flanders or Brussels.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Master's programmes at host institutions nominate eligible students after the application deadline. A Selection Committee, in collaboration with the Flemish Ministry of Education, makes the final selection based on: quality of motivation (30 points), previous study results (30 points), reasons in Recommendation letter 1 (10 points), reasons in Recommendation letter 2 (10 points), motivation for submission by host institution (10 points), and top talent profile (10 points). Preselected candidates receive an email via Mobility-Online tool.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Master Mind Scholarship is for outstanding international students to pursue a master’s degree in Flanders and Brussels, funded by the Flemish Ministry of Education and Training.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are open for the 2026-2027 academic year. University application deadlines are typically in January (e.g., Jan 15, 2026 for KU Leuven for 2026-2027). A Master Mind application form deadline of March 15, 2025, is also mentioned, though its specific academic year association is conflicting across sources.

basic_info.official_name: Beca Colombia Scholarship Programme for Foreigners
basic_info.provider: ICETEX (Colombian Institute of Educational Credit and Technical Studies Abroad), Government of Colombia

covered_expenses: Monthly Stipend (one million six hundred (1.600.000) Colombian pesos, equivalent to three Colombian legal monthly minimum wages)
One-time grant for the issuance of a foreign identification card

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Foreign citizens from all nationalities; Must not have Colombian nationality (dual nationality not allowed); Must not be residing in Colombia, nor have resided the last 6 months prior to applying for the scholarship in Colombian territory; Must not have started studies in Colombia at the time of application; Must not have been a beneficiary of this program in previous calls; Must have a professional or bachelor's degree (to pursue graduate studies).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master, Doctoral or Specialization Degree programs in public and private Colombian higher education institutions; Any study field available within many participating host universities; Programmes listed in the 2025-2 Academic Offer Catalogue.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Cumulative general average of 4.0 out of 5.0 in undergraduate studies (according to the grading scale of each country).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's, Doctoral, or Specialization Degree (postgraduate studies).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Minimum B2 level in Spanish language (written and spoken), or another certificate that endorses the level of the Spanish language. Support is provided for students from non-Spanish-speaking countries to strengthen Spanish language skills.

additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Aimed at high-achieving international students with exceptional academic merit and leadership; Scholarship recipients agree not to request a visa to remain in Colombia for two (2) years from the date the scholarship ends, and must return to their country of origin or residence.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Meeting academic, language, and documentation requirements; Must not be a beneficiary of ICETEX through the Beca Colombia Program.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcript (to prove GPA); Experience report (to verify work experience).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Students are selected with exceptional academic merit and leadership. Candidates are evaluated based on requirements and score; not obtaining a vacancy in academic program with limited quota can lead to non-selection.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Part of Colombia’s Reciprocity Programme, designed to promote academic, cultural, and technological exchange; Aims to strengthen social ties between international students and Colombian institutions; Offered by reason of reciprocity for international cooperative received by Colombia under Educational Exchange Agreements; Designed to give an opportunity to foreign citizens to strengthen their academic formation.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Academic years 2024-25, 2025/2026, 2025-2026, 2026-2027; Maximum duration of up to 24 months (4 academic semesters).

basic_info.official_name: Heydar Aliyev International Education Grant Program
basic_info.provider: Government of Azerbaijan (Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Ministry of Science and Education)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship for undergraduate, master's, PhD, and General Medicine/Residency programs.
covered_expenses: Economy Class International Flight once in a Year

timeline_info.application_deadline: May 15, 2025 (for first stage/nomination for 2025-2026 academic year)
timeline_info.opening_date: March 15, 2025 (for first stage/nomination for 2025-2026 academic year)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from OIC and NAM member countries (over 150 countries). Applicants must be academically strong, demonstrate motivation and leadership potential, and receive an official nomination by their home country government (Ministry of Foreign Affairs or Education).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Undergraduate, Master's, PhD, and General Medicine/Residency programs. Fields include Engineering, Public Health, International Relations, Agriculture, Economics, Business, IT, Humanities, and other high-demand fields. All majors of general graduate schools are available.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Undergraduate students are advised not to apply for medical-related degree programs if they are not recognized by their home country's medical council (e.g., Sri Lanka Medical Council).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 70% (for initial application); 3.0 (for annual renewal of fellowship)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's, Master's, PhD, General Medicine/Residency programs

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Language proficiency in English, Russian, Turkish, or Azerbaijani. Specific requirements: IELTS 5.5 / TOEFL 50 (for Master’s/PhD). Minimum requirements vary by program.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Below 35 for undergraduate, below 40 for masters (education.go.ug). HEC Pakistan states below 40 for Graduate and below 45 for Doctoral Programs on or before September 15, 2025.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Official nomination by home country government (Ministry of Foreign Affairs or Education) is mandatory.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed Nomination Form, Copy of Passport, Academic Transcripts & Diplomas, Language Proficiency Certificate, Medical Certificate (including HIV/AIDS, Hep B/C)
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Two-stage process: 1. Submission of applications to home country government authorities for review and evaluation. 2. Shortlisted applicants register in SIACAS (Study in Azerbaijan Centralized Admission Service) for further review and evaluation. Final selection is confirmed after delivering required documentation to the higher education institution.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship is known as the Heydar Aliyev International Education Grant Program, backed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Ministry of Science and Education. It supports studies at 20 top universities across Azerbaijan. A total of 100 scholarships are awarded annually for the duration of the candidate's program. Renewal is annual, dependent on a minimum GPA of 3.0. Specific numbers of awards vary by country/group (e.g., 3 for Pakistan/AJ&K, 20-40 for OIC/NAM, 600 for graduate schools).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Submission of applications (first stage) to home country authorities: March 15 - May 15, 2025. Review by government authorities: May 16 - May 31, 2025. Registration in SIACAS (second stage): June 1 - June 20, 2025. Review and evaluation of candidates: June 20 - July 15, 2025. Notification of selected candidates: July 16 - July 31, 2025. Start of academic year: September 15, 2025. Last date for arrival in Azerbaijan: September 30, 2025.

basic_info.official_name: Ministry of Foreign Affairs Scholarships for non-EU citizens (Scholarships offered by the Romanian state through the MFA)
basic_info.provider: Romanian Government, through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarships for international students.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 85 scholarships for under- and post-graduate (500 scholarships granted for 2023-2024 academic year)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: For international students from non-EU countries (with some exceptions for EU candidates). Candidates must have good results in education, with an average of the study years for the last graduated school of at least 7 (seven) corresponding to the scoring system in Romania or the Good score. Only applicants who have not previously received a Romanian Government scholarship for the same level of study are eligible.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 7/10 (Romanian grading system) or equivalent, or 70%, or 'Good' score.
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school diploma (for Bachelor's), Bachelor's degree (for Master's), Master's degree (for PhD).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For Bachelor's and Master's programs, study is conducted in Romanian language only. A preparatory year in Romanian is granted prior to enrolling in the study program of choice, for those not speaking Romanian. For PhD programs, applicants can choose to study in Romanian or another language set by the doctoral school; proficiency proof (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS, DELF, CEFR) is required for non-Romanian programs. Some sources state 'NO IELTS required'.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Letter of Recommendation / Letters of recommendation
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 35 years old for Bachelor's and Master's programs; Under 45 years old for PhD programs.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Only applicants who have not previously received a Romanian Government scholarship for the same level of study are eligible.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Completed application form, CV, Motivation letter, Copy of the passport, Medical certificate, Any other certificates.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed application form, Copies of Educational certificates (SSC, HSC, Bachelor's, Master's, PhD if applicable) with authorized translation, Letter of Recommendation, Diplomas/Certificates, CV, Motivation letter, Copy of the passport, Medical certificate, Professional Experience Certificate from Organization (if applicable), Any other certificates.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Document reviews, interviews, or entrance exams.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The annual scholarship programme for foreign citizens offered by the Romanian state, through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, based on Government Decision no. ####. Each year, the Romanian Government, through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, provides a number of scholarships to citizens from non-EU countries. It offers opportunities to pursue undergraduate, master’s, or doctoral studies in Romania.

funding_info.funding_details: The Australian Government provides funding to eligible Higher Education Providers (HEPs) through the RTP to support their training of domestic and overseas students undertaking Research Doctorate and Research Masters degrees. RTP Funds are used to support HDR candidates through scholarships such as RTP Tuition Fee Offsets, RTP Stipends, and RTP Allowances. The RTP provides funding for research training, with an annual stipend for living costs (e.g., $34,752 at Griffith University, $33,511 AUD for 2025 base rate).
covered_expenses: RTP Fees Offset (100% tuition fees for up to 14 research periods at University of Sydney)
Overseas Student Health Care Policy (single policy, dual-family or multi-family policy may be approved for overseas students)
Relocation costs (up to A$2,000 at UniSC)

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by university. Specific deadlines mentioned: Friday 19 June 2026 (CSU for 2027 International), Wednesday 1 October 2025, 11:59 PM AEST (ACU for 2025/2026), 31st of [incomplete] (Federation Uni for 2026, open until 11:59 PM). University of Adelaide 2025 applications are open.
timeline_info.opening_date: Varies by university. Specific opening dates mentioned: Twice per annum in April and October (ACU), 1st of September 2025 (Federation Uni for 2026).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Varies by university. A limited number (up to 6) of AGRTPS are available each year at Flinders University (International). Most universities award about 10% of their RTP scholarships to international students.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be prospective or current Higher Degree by Research (HDR) students enrolled in an accredited Research Higher Degree (Research Doctorate or Research Masters degree) at an eligible Australian Higher Education Provider. Scholarships are offered to high-achieving international and domestic students. Applicants must meet the university's academic and English language entry requirements. Domestic students are required to have a CHESSN. Applicants must have completed a degree with a substantial research component (at least 25%), such as an Honours degree or higher, or obtained equivalent international qualifications. Students must not be receiving income from another source to support their general living costs. Current Curtin HDR students must start their scholarships from 1 January. Successful scholarship recipients must enrol in a Higher Degree by Research Course at Curtin University no later than March of the following year. Applicants must clearly demonstrate their willingness and capacity to establish effective supervisory support. Scholarship holders are required to accept and commence by the dates stated in their letter of offer. Candidates are subject to all University policies and academic program requirements.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Research Doctorate degrees, Research Masters degrees

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Not explicitly stated as a general minimum, but applicants must have an outstanding record of academic achievement and academic merit is a key selection criterion. High-achieving students are targeted.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Masters by Research or doctoral degree (PhD), Higher Degree by Research (HDR), Completion of a degree with a substantial research component (at least 25%), such as an Honours degree or higher, or equivalent international qualifications.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of English language proficiency is required if English is not the applicant's first language. Applicants must meet the university's English language entry requirements.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Applicants must provide a written personal reference from a responsible person (not a relative or university staff member, as per Newcastle University's partial guideline).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants need to contact their chosen eligible higher education provider (HEP) directly. For Curtin University, applicants need to obtain an Invitation to Apply from a registered supervisor and submit an Expression of Interest form as the first step. Unless otherwise approved, part-time scholarship recipients are subject to the same restrictions on employment as full-time students. RTP Scholarship Stipend Recipients are entitled to 20 days per year of Recreation Leave. Part-time students who have completed 12 months of their Stipend scholarship are entitled to a pro-rata amount to a maximum of 30 working [incomplete].

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Curriculum Vitae (CV), proof of English language proficiency, written personal reference. An Expression of Interest form may be required as a first step.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Scholarships are awarded on the basis of academic merit and research potential. A central scholarship selection committee awards RTP scholarships. Eligible applicants may be automatically considered for all available graduate research scholarships when applying via a university's portal (e.g., Monash myApp Portal).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The RTP provides scholarships for students to undertake a higher degree by research (HDR) at an eligible Australian university. RTP scholarships include RTP Fees Offset, RTP Stipends, and RTP Allowances. The scholarship duration for a full-time Research Doctorate degree is typically 3 to 4 years (up to 3.5 years at ANU, 3 years at ACU, 3 years and 6 months at UNE, up to 3 years generally). For a part-time Research Doctorate, it can be 6 to 8 years. For a full-time Research Masters degree, the duration is typically 2 years (2 years at ACU, 2 years at UNE, up to 2 years generally).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: For full-time Research Doctorate degrees, the scholarship duration is a minimum of 3 years and up to a maximum of 4 years (at the discretion of the HEP), with some universities specifying 3.5 years or 3 years and 6 months. For part-time Research Doctorate degrees, the duration is a minimum of 6 years up to a maximum of 8 years. For full-time Research Masters degrees, the duration is typically 2 years.

funding_info.funding_details: Provides full scholarships and partial scholarships. Covers tuition fees fully or partially. Full Scholarship amounts: Bachelor: 20,000 RMB, Master: 30,000 RMB, Doctor: 40,000 RMB, Senior Scholar/Long-term Language students: 10,000 RMB.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to Non-Chinese citizens. Must be in good health and willing to obey laws and regulations in China. Must not be receiving other tuition scholarship funds. Applicants must be self-funded students studying in USTB (specific to USTB, but implies general self-funded status before BGS). For current students applying, the average score of the previous academic year must be no less than 80/100. Previous degree should preferably be from a prestigious university (or research institution) in the applicant's home country, with an average score of at least 80/100 or a GPA of 3.0.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Bachelor's, Master's, PhD, Post-doctoral, language programs, special education, exchange programs at universities in Beijing.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Average score of at least 80/100 or a GPA of 3.0 (for previous degree); average score of the previous academic year must be no less than 80/100 (for current students).
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school graduate (for undergraduate programs); Bachelor's degree (for Master's programs); Master's degree (for Doctoral programs); Master's degree or above or academic title of associate professor or above (for Senior Scholar programs).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English-taught undergraduate programs: IELTS 6.0, TOEFL 75 or above, or corresponding language proficiency proof. Exception: Applicants from English official language countries applying for English-taught majors do not need to provide English proficiency proof. Chinese-taught undergraduate programs: HSK-4 level (222 or above). Chinese-taught postgraduate programs: HSK-5 level or above. Applicants for English-taught programs do not need to submit Chinese proficiency test scores at the time of application.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation (incomplete source, likely from professors/associate professors).
additional_requirements.career_plan: Statement of Purpose clearly indicating duration and purpose of study, preferred technical work or experience and academic background.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 25 years old (for undergraduate programs); Under 35 years old (for Master's programs); Under 40 years old (for Doctoral programs); Under 50 years old (for Senior Scholar programs).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must not be receiving other tuition scholarship funds.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Completed application materials, Statement of Purpose, Two letters of recommendation (incomplete source), necessary documents (general term).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: University-level selection process. International students’ office (e.g., PKU, USTB) is responsible for acceptance, review, and approval of applications.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Designed to support outstanding international students to study or conduct scientific research at universities in Beijing, aiming to promote the development of higher education of International students in Beijing.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Duration: Duration of the candidate's program. Scholarship period less than four years for bachelor’s, master’s degrees and post-doctoral. Scholarship period less than one year for professors and international students for special education/language studies/exchange programs.

basic_info.official_name: National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic (NSP)
basic_info.provider: Government of the Slovak Republic, Ministry of Education, Research, Development, and Youth (or Science, Research, and Sport) of the Slovak Republic

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded program covering living costs. Monthly stipends range from €620 to €1470, with some sources mentioning up to €1025 or €1470, and an annual stipend of €14,400 (for Master's, PhD).
covered_expenses: Travel allowance (for students and PhD students)

timeline_info.application_deadline: Multiple deadlines exist: April 30, 2025 (first round) and October 31, 2025 (second round) for the 2025/2026 academic year. A new call for applications for the summer semester of 2026/2027 is also open. Specific deadlines mentioned include 31 October 2025 (16:00 CET) and 30th October.
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are open for the 2025/2026 and 2026/2027 academic years.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International nationals (excluding Slovakia) studying or working outside Slovakia. Must be accepted by a Slovak host institution for a mobility stay. Eligible categories include Master’s students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers, and artists. Applicants should not have studied in Slovakia before (for international students). Must be from an eligible country. Also supports Slovak university students, PhD students, and postdocs for stays abroad.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Supports short-term academic, research, teaching, or artistic stays. Specific subject areas are mentioned as listed by the provider, with 'Computer Science' appearing as an example.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Primarily for short-term academic, research, teaching, or artistic stays (mobility), not full Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree programs. The scholarship for a Tanzanian student is only for studies conducted in the Slovak language.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.0 is required (source: Facebook group, may not be universally official).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s and PhD students (for short-term mobility). Bachelor's leading to Master's degree studies for specific cases (e.g., Tanzanian students).

experience_requirements.min_years: At least 2 years of work experience as a university teacher/researcher/artist (PhD studies are considered as work experience).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Applications and attachments can be submitted in Slovak or English language. For a specific scholarship (Tanzanian student), studies must be conducted in the Slovak language.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Between 18 and 26 for Bachelor's and Master's degree candidates, and between 23 and 35 for PhD degree candidates.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: If, due to extraordinary circumstances caused by force majeure, unofficial translations may be accepted, but official translations will be required before the official letter of award is issued.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must be accepted by a Slovak host institution for a mobility stay. Must be admitted or invited to a local university.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Required application materials are mentioned, but a specific list is not provided. Attachments must be in Slovak or English.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Scholarships are awarded on a competitive basis.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Established in 2005 by the Government of the Slovak Republic to support mobility of students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers, and artists for short-term stays at higher education institutions and research organizations in Slovakia. Also supports Slovak nationals for stays abroad.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship stays can be planned during the summer semester. Duration of scholarship stays: 1-2 full semesters (4-5 or 9-10 months) for students; 1-10 months for PhD students, university teachers, researchers, or artists. Program dates for a specific period were Oct 24 – Dec 12, 2025.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded program. All expenses will be covered. An amount of IDR 1,500,000 will be provided towards. During BIPA and Academic Program, the KNB students will receive research and book allowance monthly upon their arrival in Indonesia during their duration scholarship.

timeline_info.number_of_awards: 222 (in 2024, consisting of 30 Bachelor, 162 Master, and 30 Doctoral awardees). 200 scholarships across all levels of study and fields (this year, referring to 2025).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Designed for students from developing countries. Applicants cannot register without a recommendation letter from the Indonesian Representative in the relevant country.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Engineering, Economics, Health Sciences, Social Studies, all Academic Fields & Majors, 998 study programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 2.30/3.00 or equivalent (for Master's/Doctoral, from one source). 3.0/4.0 (for Bachelor's, from another source). Minimum GPA of 3.5/4.0 for undergraduate programs or 3.7/4.0 for graduate studies (from another source).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor’s, Master’s, or Doctoral degrees. Applicants must hold a bachelor degree (for Master's/Doctoral applicants, one source states master degree holder is not eligible for bachelor scholarship). Hold a master degree (for Doctoral applicants).

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Government employee, Professional Experience Certificate from Organization

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English or Japanese proficiency required (TOEFL, JLPT, etc.). Minimum TOEFL ITP 500, TOEFL IBT 61, IELTS 6.0, TOEIC 575 (Valid within the last 2 years). TOEFL (or other certified English Proficiency).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation Letter from the employer/immediate supervisor (in English or Bahasa if working). Academic Recommendation Letter from Previous Schools. Recommendation letter from the potential research supervisor (for doctoral applicant only).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Maximum age to apply for the scholarship is 35 years old (for Bachelor's). Candidates cannot be more than 40 years old (for Master's/Doctoral).
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must intend to study full-time. No Application Fee.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Final Diploma, Institutional Reputation (for recommendation letter), work history (if any), scanned degree certificate and academic transcripts in English (for Master's/Doctoral), Academic Certificate and Academic Transcript from previous degree.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Selection Results will be broadcasted online through the KNB Scholarship Website and officially announced through the Indonesian Embassy publication.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Prestigious fully funded program. Part of Indonesia’s global cooperation efforts (South–South Partnership). Aims to strengthen Indonesia's educational diplomacy. Offers an experience of studying in top universities in Indonesia and living in one of the world’s most diverse and vibrant society. Managed by 31 (thirty-one) university partners (in 2024). 34 Indonesian universities are participating in the KNB program.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: KNB Scholarship Year 2025/2026 for Bachelor, Master, and Doctoral Degrees. KNB Scholarship 2026. Indonesian Government KNB Scholarships 2026-2027.
